trends: There have been 15 other sightings in Waterbury
There were no other sightings in Waterbury on or around July 16th 2008
divs: sighting detailsufos reported in waterbury mixed in with routine domestic arguments, nuisances and petty crime, waterbury police responded to calls of ufos in the night sky wednesday. "they got several calls from the wilson street area; so far we haven't found anything yet," police spokesman lt. christopher corbett said shortly after 8 p.m. susan matthews, a printer who lives on wilson street, placed one of those calls. later, she said she saw planes traveling in the company of strange, bright, circular objects for about 20 minutes around 8 p.m. altogether, there were 15 or more planes and globes, matthews said. they traveled in small clusters, with maybe one plane for several globes, she said, traveling southwest to east. the globes left no trail and made no sound, she said. her neighbor, sue couture, had a similar story. so did sharon d'andrea, a tinker school cafeteria aide who lives on wilson street. d'andrea said she, her daughter, and 12-year-old grandson spent more than an hour watching clusters of strange, slow-moving objects heading east. "the eerie thing about them was they were unbelievably quiet," d'andrea said. "they seemed to be moving very deliberately." staff at the operations center at bradley international airport said they had no reports of clusters of aircraft heading east from the waterbury area, nor did matthew kelley, manager of the waterbury-oxford airport. "if you find any aliens, let me know, because they owe us landing fees," kelly said. from waterbury republican american july 17, 2008 http:\\www.rep-am.com\articles\2008\07\17\news\doc487f316b5b3bc348366680.txt
